question: Infection, demylinating disease and small vessels ???FINDINGS: Again noted is a single focal area of abnormal T2 signalhyperintensity in the subcortical white matter of the right frontallobe with an extensive differential including: sequela of migraineheadaches, sequela of previous trauma, demyelinating disease (ADEM,MS), infection (Lyme disease), and chronic small vessel ischemicdisease (found in patients with long-standing hypertension and/ordiabetes).
